alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 8:52AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Columbia. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water reaches the base of the levee at the old location of Columbia Park * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CDT Tuesday was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 15.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall early Thursday morning. It will rise to 16.3 feet Friday evening. It will then fall early Monday afternoon. It will then rise again and remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 600 PM CDT.
